intro: Biscutella valentina, commonly known as the Valentina's biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and produces yellow or white flowers in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its roots are fleshy and often used in traditional medicine. Biscutella valentina is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
